website_summaries.verdict: Good value on a case that will effectively keep your crossbow and accessories secure.
pros: Tie-down straps helps to protect accessories inside the case
Case is large and padded well
It also comes at a very low price
Camouflage cover helps keep it concealed when you are on a hunt
cons: This case does not have straps for carrying

customer_reviews.title: Product does not come with a "Shoulder Strap" despite what ...
customer_reviews.text: Product does not come with a "Shoulder Strap" despite what is stated in the description! . "Mossy Oak Crossbow Storage Case, Unknown, Black/Infinity Ships from and sold by Amazon.com. • 3/4" padding in stock and scope area. • Shoulder strap included. • Heavy duty zipper with double pulls ."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy
customer_reviews.text: Can accommodate crossbow with overall length of ca40" and limb width of ca30". Plenty roomy for the 150 Lbs Wood Crossbow with 2 Arrows by Last Punch available from Amazon. No internal arrow compartments but plenty of room for arrows as well as a broadhead carrying case plus a cocking rope and the necessary string and rail lubes.
customer_reviews.author: I am not Rappaport

customer_reviews.title: Great dust cover
customer_reviews.text: Case is adequate for storage. It offers little to no real protection if you’re using it travel. Great dust cover for my Sniper 370 which has become my backup crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Branon

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you measure
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my bow at all I would say I have about 70% of empty spare on it makes it look like crap when its in there and you transport around I bought another at local sporting goods store that fit perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Noe B

customer_reviews.title: It is more like 1/4 inch
customer_reviews.text: The padding is not 3/4 inch as stated. It is more like 1/4 inch. It is advertised that a shoulder strap comes with it, and it does not. There is a handle to carry it in your hand only. I do not appreciate things being advertised when it is not true. Like a dummy I did not read the reviews before buying. Will do in the future. But shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: No shoulder strap!
customer_reviews.text: Case is a good case for the price. The description states it comes with shoulder strap and doesn't. Very misleading. Wouldn't have bought it if I knew of that one important detail. Don't buy if you're wanting one with a shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: W.L. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: good fit plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: i have a horton brotherhood. i read other reviews before i bought this and they said it was a tight fit or their crossbow or it barely fit in the case. i didnt have any problems plenty of room. Take the quiver off and it fits perfect. Come on jack wagons if your going to say yours don't fit tell everyone what crossbow you have.
customer_reviews.author: kyates

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Roomy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item. Well made and padded. Room for extras. Unfortunately, mine came in a damaged and wet package and there was a tear in the case. Probably the tear occurred in transit.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Good to protect your crossbow in storage
customer_reviews.text: The case covers perfectly my SA Sports Fever crossbow with its scope. I would love if it had some few internal or externl zipped compartiments to carry extra items like spare parts or small accesories, I dont think they would be difficult to include and possibly I will add them myself. Also it needs more external carrying points, maybe to attach a shoulder sling or holder to keep the crossbow protected while walking...
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Moreno

customer_reviews.title: OK item
customer_reviews.text: More of a bag....you get what you pay for. Good enough for storing your crossbow. Don't use for travel!
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: okay but only has one loop to hook a strap to so don't but if your plans were to use as a in-filed carrying case- it will not work!
customer_reviews.author: Your Mom's House

customer_reviews.title: Mossy Oak Crossbow Storage Case
customer_reviews.text: I was a little surprised at how it came folded up and how the zipper works. However once unfolded it holds my Jackal bow just fine. I also have room for bolts and extras.
customer_reviews.author: Inventor

customer_reviews.title: Recommend verifying all measurements before buying this case
customer_reviews.text: Case fits too large for my crossbow - the pocket for the red dot sight is too far back on the case making the fit very awkward. Recommend verifying all measurements before buying this case. A shoulder strap for the case would have been a major plus. Also no pocket for the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Ironpike

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Nicely fit for my Sniper 370 crossbow. Plenty room for accessories
customer_reviews.author: Maxim Matsnev

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One for my lady raptor and one for my son's crossbow. It doesn't have as much padding as I would like, but it is still sturdily built and seems like it will last a while. It was a little bit of a struggle to get the bows into the bag. It seemed like the bag could have been a little bigger at the top. The part of the bag where the stock goes had plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Decent case for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much a decent crossbow case. I didn't necessarily want a heavily padded case, just something to keep the dust off and give some protection against dings. This case does that and won't set you back a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Davo68

customer_reviews.title: nice case if you don't use a scope.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice case and will probobly fit just about any crossbow, but the main issue I ran into was that my scope barely fits it properly at all. Interestingly enough, the scope is wider in the back where the sholder rest is and lesser in the middle where the scope would be. Not a very well though out design but cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Products Finder

customer_reviews.title: Great for the noney
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Ain't really nothing but a dust protector. I recommend it if you want to cover your crossbow
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to archery and wanted to make sure I had a good case. I did. Very nice look.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Fiance likes it so......
customer_reviews.text: Crossbow fit perfectly. I bought for fiance and he likes it so that's all that matters to me!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Looman

customer_reviews.title: Good case for the price
customer_reviews.text: The case was a perfectly inexpensive way to store my crossbow. The handle was more then adaquate to carry it...it's not a shoulder strap but still effective.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES L ALBANESE

customer_reviews.title: Padding
customer_reviews.text: Much more padding than I was led to believe when reading reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Lawson Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Fits Parker Xbow
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Plenty of room for my Parker enforcer with quiver and scope. Doesn't have shoulder strap. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: John Ward

customer_reviews.title: Decent soft case. Made well and will fit most ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent soft case. Made well and will fit most bows. Did not come with a strap and could use at least one accessory pocket. It is a tight fit around the scope area of my blow ant there is little padding.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Crossbow soft case
customer_reviews.text: This is a super nice soft case for your crossbow. Heavy cordura material with very decent padding. Best cover you can buy for the price IMO. FYI it will not fit Arrow Precison Wildfire II or Excalibur recurve crossbows. The limbs are too long.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: ***FALSE DESCRIPTION***
customer_reviews.text: The case itself is ok, but the advertised shoulder strap is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Large storage capacity
customer_reviews.text: I like that it fits my crossbow and extra arrows. I don’t like that it doesn’t have a strap to sling over your shoulder. It would be a lot easier to carry it over the shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This case isn't padded but it does the job just fine. My Barnett Jackal fits in it just fine with room enough for my quiver and a few extras. I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bubby

customer_reviews.title: It's huge!
customer_reviews.text: This case was huge, it's almost big enough to fit two bows in!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Goodell

customer_reviews.title: It has a scope on it and seemed to fit fine. Only drawback was there was not a strap ...
customer_reviews.text: This was for my son's crossbow. It has a scope on it and seemed to fit fine. Only drawback was there was not a strap provided with it, but it does have a way to carry it without the strap. Matter of preference. Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: braydenrazor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The bag fits nice and snug with the scope and loaded quiver.
customer_reviews.author: O. HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, fits my crossbow with room to spare. Has room for a sight if one is mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. The only thing I could say 'against' ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. The only thing I could say 'against' it is that it doesn't have a shoulder strap. Apart from that, its exactly what I needed/wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Mike owen

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if there were extra compartments for bow wax and ...
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if there were extra compartments for bow wax and broad-heads, but aside from that it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Josh w

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this crossbow case. It does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this crossbow case. It does not come with the inside tie down straps or the shoulder sling as stated in the item description.
customer_reviews.author: Foggywayne

customer_reviews.title: Good, economical storage option.
customer_reviews.text: I acquired a second crossbow and need a good storage option for it when not in use. This case is the right quality for the right price and still meets my needs. It's nothing fancy but it stores my Barnett Predator with scope just fine. There are no separate pockets for the quiver, bolts, or accessories unless you put them in along with the crossbow main compartment.
customer_reviews.author: John Burnside

customer_reviews.title: No shoulder strap with case.
customer_reviews.text: We received the crossbow case with no Shoulder strap. We like the case but my son was unhappy because the shoulder strap wasn't with it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: My major disappointment was that there was NO shoulder strap as stated ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine came fairly fast and safely packed in a box. It seems to be well made, but the padding is only about 1/4 inch if that. My major disappointment was that there was NO shoulder strap as stated in the description. Somebody isn't doing their job by leaving the line in the description saying shoulder strap included. I read the reviews before purchasing and knew there was a good chance the strap would be missing. Still, my beef is with the continuing false claim.
customer_reviews.author: Menotaur

customer_reviews.title: Customers care Great
customer_reviews.text: Great return policy. I had no problems with customers care, they even found the right one for me and place it in my cart to order.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Kahoopii

customer_reviews.title: Like a Glove... Without Pockets
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Centerpoint Sniper 370 quite well! Wish it had a storage pocket for some odds and ends (cocking cord, for example)
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Chauvin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great case that is super durable and fits my crossbow well!
customer_reviews.author: S. Schliessman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Barnett recruit wouldn't fit in it, its to short (3-4")
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence M. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Light
customer_reviews.text: Firs the bow an very easy to pack an go hunting
customer_reviews.author: Brian Engh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The crossbow fits in the case even with the arrows.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my daughter and she liked it .
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Raines

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good for price.. Not made real well but will work
customer_reviews.author: Dave T

customer_reviews.title: Great dust cover
customer_reviews.text: Really thin foamy/rubbery material. Will protect from dust but not rough handling.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: It's alright, keeps my crossbow from being banged up but it's a pain to zip up all the way.
customer_reviews.author: adis

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: Case was way too big for my crossbow but still a decent product
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price, but could use at least 1 pocket.
customer_reviews.author: KMcD

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case for the money! more room than I thought it would have. It would be ideal if it had two rings for strap.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky J Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: It's good and fit. My friend really like it. I bought it for him and he paid me with 2 more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: but it does zip up fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Kind of tight fit with the quiver attached to the bow, but it does zip up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rich in Bangor

customer_reviews.title: Well made, pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Great deal, fits my SA Dragon great, glad I ordered it
customer_reviews.author: eldrad1

customer_reviews.title: NO SHOULDER STRAP WITH MINE
customer_reviews.text: Very big for my Barnett raptor fx and DID NOT COME WITH A SHOULDER STRAP!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Keefer

customer_reviews.title: No quality control for this product.
customer_reviews.text: The zipper pull was open on the opposite side because it did not match up properly. I zipped it up and it started opening from the closed end. The product looked nice felt it was made of quality material. But the zipper thing just blew me away. Oh,no tie downs in it and no shoulder strap to boot. Very dissatisfied. Amazon credited me though,give kudos for excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: MWJII

customer_reviews.title: Real mossy oak product
customer_reviews.text: Little hard getting in and taking out. But good for storage. Just hope it does mess up my scope. A little tight with a scope on. Very nice made. And it's the real deal. I like mine. I recommend it. Big money in crossbow. So spend a little and protect it. 2thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: TATTOOMIKE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice for my grandson's bow we got him for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Albertson

customer_reviews.title: what a hasssle
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the case is really good, however the vendor was a nightmare, I received multiple shipping and arrival dates, none of which were correct, then found that the case went to postal center no where near my home, several contacts with vender resulted in them telling me to drive up to the postal center and see if was really there, Amazon was nice and gave me a gift card, and I was able to order another case from another vender and it was here in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: John O. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with my purchase. It met what I needed and fit my crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Happy Husband!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for protecting the Cross Bow. Great Price. Would buy again. Love the Camo!
customer_reviews.author: Stay at Home Mama!

customer_reviews.title: Missing strap.
customer_reviews.text: Had to one star this one. It was missing the shoulder strap. :(
customer_reviews.author: Karen Warrick

customer_reviews.title: Not as described!!
customer_reviews.text: Not padded as stated at all, very dissatisfied with this item! All it does is store it not protect it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Halliday

customer_reviews.title: Case
customer_reviews.text: I sent one back because it did not have a strap as advertised. I was told the next one would be checked and it also did not have the strap as advertised. It was sent express shipping the second one which i thought was nice. I decided to keep the second one and make my own strap but there is only one clip for a strap instead of two ? No compensation of any kind was offered to keep a customer happy. Not a good move for a business that rely's on customers to stay in business.
customer_reviews.author: kevin douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great, well made case
customer_reviews.text: Great case, well made but had to return it because it didn't fit the pistol crossbows that I had purchased I looked high and low to find a carry case for my pistol crossbows and only found a few out of England - funny thing is, I ended up using a very well made backpack that Dell had sent to me as part of an order when I purchased a gaming XPS laptop. The laptop was HUGE and the backpack weights a ton by itself, but it fits 2 of my pistol crossbows and all of my misc. supplies in it.....who knew? LOL
customer_reviews.author: BJ Hix

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice material and fits my crossbow with a scope. Isn't baggy, it fits snuggly around it. Grade A.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it, just wish it came with a shoulder strap. A little disappointed about that
customer_reviews.author: Dotty D

customer_reviews.title: FOR THE PRICE,  U CANT BEAT IT  :)
customer_reviews.text: REALLY GOOD QUALITY fits probably even the biggest x-bows, scoped or not, and has room for gear still inside
customer_reviews.author: monty breedlove

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case for my crossbow did not have any trouble, crossbow fit perfect in it
customer_reviews.author: mike wommer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered for him for his birthday and he was happy with it
customer_reviews.text: This was on my husband's wishlist. I ordered for him for his birthday and he was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but I would prefer the hard case.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the money, but I would go with a hard case if I had to buy one again. I have a Barnett Recruit and it does fit into it, but not a good fit at all. Not that it's the cases fault. I just don't like the soft case now that I have one and am throwing it up on the shelf for storage and hauling it around for target practice and hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: No tie downs, no sling
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case for my 150 crossbow. The case is big enough for my size bow plus some. It is a mossy oak case. Good quality for the price. But buyer beware!!!! There is no strap, no tie downs or any extra anything! I bought this after reading other reviews that warned me that these items were not included. I ordered it anyhow. If the ad wasn't so misleading it would have rated a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my purpose. Hard to zip if arrow holder attached
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth V Hulse

customer_reviews.title: Hubby is a happy camper!!
customer_reviews.text: This crossbow case is perfect for the crossbow my husband ordered from Amazon. It is very well-made and the price reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: DaMama

customer_reviews.title: Crossbow Storage case.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this case for my crossbow and it came in just a little short. I can get most of my bow in it but I have a little bit of one arm sticking out. It works but I would like to have a little more room in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: crossbow storage
customer_reviews.text: It is. A. Great soft. Case I only gave it a 4 due to no way to lock it up to keep children out of it . The case protects the cross bow
customer_reviews.author: Keith Nidy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I had my crossbow sitting out forever and when I moved I thought, I put my guns in cases, why not my crossbow? It is the perfect size for both the crossbow, mounts and bolts and a bonus "ring" for hanging in my garage. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Merritt Depew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband, it works perfectly for what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be durable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my sons crossbow, quiver, spare quiver, cocking rope, and a tool kit. Seems to be durable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: bls

customer_reviews.title: He loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son along with a crossbow for Xmas. He just loved them both. This case is nicely padded and fit the crossbow almost perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Hauber

customer_reviews.title: false advertising
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT COME WITH SHOULDER STRAP!!!!!!!OR HAVE THE TIE DOWN STRAPS ON THE INSIDE JUST A FLIMSY CHEAP CASE...NOT EVEN WORTH 10 BUCKS IN MY OPINION.
customer_reviews.author: Freyr

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for the deal I got on it. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: It was like it was too small
customer_reviews.text: it was very hard to get it zipped. It was like it was too small.
customer_reviews.author: michael buckley

customer_reviews.title: Very well made case at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Does what its suppose to do, protect the crossbow when not in use. Made very well and holds my Barnett Recruit with red dot with no issue's. For the price, hard to beat. Also looks great!
customer_reviews.author: The Pusher

product_meta.title: Mossy Oak Crossbow Storage Case, Unknown, Black/Infinity
product_meta.description: Crossbow Storage Case Includes inside tie-down straps for accessories, and sift padded inside to ensure your corssbows safely secure. Fits most crossbows and accessories.
feature_bullets: 3/4" padding in stock and scope area
Heavy duty zipper with double pulls

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
